question: Question_10
statement:
Let $A = \begin{pmatrix}16&-9\\30&-17\end{pmatrix}$ Then, given that
$A = \begin{pmatrix}3&1\\5&2\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}1&0\\0&-2\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}2&-1\\-5&3\end{pmatrix}$
find the matrix $A^{10}$. (There may be some powers of 2 in the answer,
but you should get a single matrix).
sols:
Notice that $A = SDS^{-1}$ which is the diagonalization formula where
$S = \begin{bmatrix}3&1\\5&2\end{bmatrix}$ and
$D = \begin{bmatrix}1&0\\0&-2\end{bmatrix}$
$A^{10} = SD^{10}S^{-1} = \begin{bmatrix}3&1\\5&2\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}1&0\\0&-2\end{bmatrix}^{10}\begin{bmatrix}2&-1\\-5&3\end{bmatrix} =\begin{bmatrix}3&2^{10}\\5&2^{11}\end{bmatrix}\begin{bmatrix}2&-1\\-5&3\end{bmatrix}$$=\begin{bmatrix}6-5(2)^{10}&-3+3(2)^{10}\\10-5(2)^{11}&-5+3(2)^{11}\end{bmatrix}$
